greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1 + 2*x^2) / (1 - 2*x^2 - x^3 + 2*x^5 + 2*x^6 - x^8 - 2*x^9 + x^11) in powers of x.
comment: The number of quadruples of integers [x, u, v, w] which satisfy x > u > v > w >=0, n+7 = x+u, (u+v < x+w and x+u+v+w is even) or (u+v > x+w and x+u+v+w is odd).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,1,0,-2,-2,0,1,2,0,-1).
formula: a(n+3) - a(n) = 0 if n even else A001859((n+5)/2) for all n in Z.
a(n) = -A254707(-9 - n) for all n in Z.
mathematica: a[ n_] := Length @ FindInstance[ {x > u, u > v, v > w, w >= 0, x + u == n + 7, (u + v < x + w && x + u + v + w == 2 k) || (u + v > x + w && x + u + v + w == 2 k + 1)}, {x, u, v, w, k}, Integers, 10^9];
program: (MAGMA) m:=50; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), m); Coefficients(R!((2 + x^2)/(1-2*x^2-x^3+2*x^5+2*x^6-x^8-2*x^9+x^11))); // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 03 2018
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Feb 06 2015
